hedline.hl1: Metro Business; New Airport Bus Service

abstract.p: Port Authority begins bus service from George Washington Bridge Bus Station in upper Manhattan to Kennedy International and Newark International Airports; operator is Airports Service Corp (S)

block.p: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has begun a new bus service from its George Washington Bridge Bus Station to Kennedy International and Newark International Airports.
The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has begun a new bus service from its George Washington Bridge Bus Station to Kennedy International and Newark International Airports.

The agency said Monday that the service, which includes four departures a day to each airport and carries a $20 fare, started last month from the bus station, at Broadway and 179th Street in Washington Heights. Agency officials said it was an alternative for those seeking lower fares to the two airports from Upper Manhattan, the Bronx and the northern New York City suburbs. The new service is provided by a private company, Airports Service Corporation.
